    • getJoinGameCommandString

      public static String getJoinGameCommandString(String playerName)
      The getJoinGameCommandString function takes a player name as input and returns a string that can be sent to the server to join the game. The format of this string is: -2,J,playerName\n
      Parameters:
      playerName - String Identify the player who is joining the game
      Returns:
      A string that represents a join game command

      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is sending the command
      Returns:
      A string that contains the player id and a startgame command

    • getTryPlaceWordCommandString

      public static String getTryPlaceWordCommandString(int playerId, String word, int row, int col, boolean vertical)
      The getTryPlaceWordCommandString function takes in a playerId, word, row, col and vertical boolean. It returns a string that is formatted as follows: "playerId" + "," + commandToChar.get(GameCommand.TryPlaceWord) + "," + word + ","
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is trying to place a word
      word - String Pass in the word that is being placed on the board
      row - int Determine the row of the board where a word will be placed
      col - int Determine the column of the word to be placed
      vertical - boolean Determine whether the word is placed vertically or horizontally static public string gettryplacewordcommandstring(int playerid, string word, int row, int col) { return gettryplacewordcommandstring(playerid, word, row ,col ,true); }
      Returns:
      A string in the following format:

    • getChallengeCommandString

      public static String getChallengeCommandString(int playerId, String word, int row, int col, boolean vertical)
      The getChallengeCommandString function takes in a playerId, word, row, col and vertical. It returns a string that is formatted as follows: "playerId" + "," + commandToChar.get(GameCommand.Challenge) + "," + word + ","+ row+","+col+","vertical". This function is used to create the challenge command string for the server to read from clients.
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is making the challenge
      word - String Pass the word that is being challenged
      row - int Specify the row of the board where you want to place a word
      col - int Determine the column that the word is placed in
      vertical - boolean Determine if the word is placed vertically or horizontally static public string getplacewordcommandstring(int playerid, string word, int row, int col, boolean vertical) { return playerid + "," + commandtochar
      Returns:
      A string in the format:

    • getGetBoardCommandString

      public static String getGetBoardCommandString(int playerId)
      The getGetBoardCommandString function takes in a playerId and returns a string that is the command to get the board.
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player that is sending the command
      Returns:
      A string of the form "playerid,command"

    • getGetRandTileString

      public static String getGetRandTileString(int playerId)
      The getGetRandTileString function takes in a playerId and returns a string that can be sent to the server. The string is formatted as follows: "playerId,GetRandTile"
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is making the request
      Returns:
      A string that is composed of the playerid and a character representing the getrandtile command

    • getSetGameDictionariesString

      public static String getSetGameDictionariesString(int playerId, String[] dictionaries)
      The getSetGameDictionariesString function takes in a playerId and an array of dictionaries, and returns a string that can be sent to the server. The string is formatted as follows: "playerId,commandChar,dictionaryName0,...dictionaryNameN,"endDictionaries"
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is sending the message
      dictionaries - String[] Pass the dictionaries to be used in the game
      Returns:
      A string that contains the playerid and a list of dictionaries

    • getSkipTurnString

      public static String getSkipTurnString(int playerId)
      The getSkipTurnString function returns a string that represents the command to skip a turn.
      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify the player who is skipping their turn
      Returns:
      A string that is a comma-separated list of the player id and the character representation of gamecommand

      public static String getSwapTilesString(int playerId)

      Parameters:
      playerId - int Identify which player is making the move
      Returns:
      A string that contains the player id and a character representing the command
